title: Vijay Singh (Fijian politician)
text:
Vijay Singh is a former <a href="Fiji">Fiji</a>an politician of <a href="India">India</a>n descent, who represented the <a href="Vuda%20%28Open%20Constituency%2C%20Fiji%29">Vuda</a> <a href="Open%20constituencies">Open Constituency</a> in the <a href="House%20of%20Representatives%20of%20Fiji">House of Representatives</a> for the <a href="Fiji%20Labour%20Party">Fiji Labour Party</a> (FLP) from 2001 to 2006, having retained the seat at the <a href="2001%20Fijian%20general%20election">2001 parliamentary election</a> with more than 57 percent of the votes cast.
In 2003, Singh was offered the portfolio of Minister for Fair Trading & Consumer Affairs, together with 13 other FLP parliamentarians who were offered cabinet positions by the Prime Minister, <a href="Laisenia%20Qarase">Laisenia Qarase</a> but the FLP refused to accept this offer.
The <a href="2006%20Fijian%20general%20election">parliamentary election</a> held on 6–13 May 2006 was marked by intrigue. The FLP replaced Singh as its candidate with then-<a href="Senate%20of%20Fiji">Senator</a> <a href="Felix%20Anthony">Felix Anthony</a>, on what Singh claims was an undertaking that he would be given Anthony's seat in the Senate. This did not eventuate, and Singh pursued legal action against the FLP leader, <a href="Mahendra%20Chaudhry">Mahendra Chaudhry</a>, for reneging on the promise that he was alleged to have made. Chaudhry, for his part, denied having given any such promise.
